subject: Re: [junit] how to use junit after installing
msgSnippet: I saw this mail after going through your previous one. You only need to put the installation directory in classpath, as the tests are not bundled in jar. This
messageBody:
I saw this mail after going through your previous one. You only need to put
the
installation directory in classpath, as the tests are not bundled in jar.
This is very clearly mentioned in README

On 3/22/06, p_pande123 <p_pande123@...> wrote:
>
> hi all,
> I have installed junit with zip file and also set the calsspath but
> then also when i want to execute AllTests file it shows me error
> AllTests class not define.
>
> Pl. give me solution
>
> Regards
> Prashant Pande
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
